studyMetadata.title: Experiment on Analysts' Memory and Recall - Part 2
studyMetadata.description: Brief survey on anlayst' memory and recall'.

uiConfig.studyEndMsg:
**That is the end!**
Please reach out to Melissa if you have questions.

**Thank you for completing the study. You have made SCADS proud!**

response.prompt: When youâ€™re ready to begin, type in the ID value you got from Melissa over email and click next.
response.placeholder: Type in the same ID value you got from Melissa over email for part-1 of the study and click next.

response.prompt: David Burns of NASA's Marshall Space Flight Center proposed a new idea called a 'helical engine'.
The helical engine would only operate in a frictionless environment.
Deep space travel has to consider thrust versus large propellant storage tanks.
The helical engine relies on quantum tunneling to achieve fuel-free propulsion.
Burns' helical engine has been endorsed by several prominent physicists who believe it could redefine space travel.
The helical engine has been successfully tested in a laboratory environment.
SwRI leads NASA's New Horizons mission.
New Horizons has enough fuel for another mission.
The small Kuiper Belt object (KBO) New Horizons flew by is called Ultima Thule.
SwRI said the Pluto orbiter will include a lander capable of drilling into Pluto's surface to search for signs of life.
NASA has already allocated a specific launch date for the SwRI Pluto orbiter mission, set for 2025.
The SwRI Pluto orbiter will utilize AI to autonomously navigate and conduct scientific experiments without human intervention.
Astronaut Buzz Aldrin thinks NASA won't land on Mars until around 2040.
Bridenstine thinks the moon is the perfect test ground for technologies that would help us live and work on Mars.
Jim Bridenstine and Mike Pence both spoke at the International Astronautical Congress.
The Artemis program will include the development of a new space station in Mars orbit, intended to be operational by 2030.
Jim Bridenstine announced that NASA has already completed the construction of the spacecraft that will take humans to Mars.
Vice President Mike Pence stated that private companies like SpaceX and Blue Origin will not be involved in the NASA Mars mission.
The Samsung "Space Selfie" contained cameras and a Samsung phone.
Welke had their power cut off by the Samsung crash landing.
The person who retrieved the Space Selfie contraption was from Raven Industries.
The Samsung balloon had been circling the Earth for over a month before it finally descended.
The parachuted Samsung object caused significant damage to the Welke's barn and fencing.
Nancy Welke and her husband received financial compensation from Samsung for recovering the device.
SpaceX has already been contracted by Intuitive Machines and ispace to deliver payloads to the Moon.
SpaceX's Mk1 and Mk2 high altitude test vehicle will be proceeded by ships that test orbital flight.
SpaceX's Starship is intended to be a successor to both Falcon 9 and Falcon Heavy.
Gwynne Shotwell announced that SpaceX will partner with the European Space Agency (ESA) to develop a lunar base by 2025.
SpaceX has already completed an orbital test flight of the Starship.
Elon Musk claimed he will be launching a mission to explore the outer edges of the solar system using the Starship by 2030.
The Mars 2020 rover will be named by a contest from US students.
The descent vehicle for the Mars 2020 rover can adjust using retrorockets to allow for an autonomous landing.
The Mars 2020 rover has a "rocker-bogie" suspension system.
NASA has partnered with Tesla to install solar panels on the Mars 2020 rover, allowing it to recharge during its mission.
The Mars 2020 rover includes an advanced water detection system that can map underground water reserves on Mars.
The Mars 2020 rover will be the first rover to carry a drone that will assist in mapping and scouting the Martian terrain.
Bigelow's B330 lunar habitat is inflatable and meant to protect inhabitants from radiation and debris.
NASA wants to review all five Gateway mockups so they can take pieces they do and do not like from each.
Lockheed Martin's inflatable lunar habitat design is adapted from a previous shipping container design.
NASA intends to include a small greenhouse in each lunar habitat to grow food for the astronauts.
Each lunar habitat will be equipped with a 3D printer that can create any tool or spare part needed by the astronauts.
NASA asked five companies for blueprints of lunar habitats, but did not commission prototypes of these habitats to be built.
OTV-5 flew higher than the previous X-37B flights.
The success of X-37B results from a government and industry partnership.
The first X-37B mission (OTV-1) spent less than a year in orbit.
The X-37B space plane is capable of carrying astronauts in addition to its payloads.
The X-37B space plane was developed by SpaceX in collaboration with NASA.
The OTV-5 mission was the first to be launched from the newly constructed Air Force facility in Alaska.
SpaceX's successful Crew Dragon test flight concludes the investigation of the previous leaky valves.
The last test of the Crew Dragon before they can be certified will be sending two astronauts up to the ISS.
The Crew Dragon's emergency abort engines are known as SuperDracos.
The Crew Dragon capsule is designed to carry up to 12 astronauts at a time.
SpaceX plans to launch the Crew Dragon directly to Mars as part of its Commercial Crew Program.
SpaceX has partnered with the European Space Agency to co-develop the Crew Dragon's emergency systems.
Two astronauts will soon do four spacewalks to repair the Alpha Magnetic Spectrometer (AMS) outside the ISS.
The AMS needs repair because one pump failed, followed by a second one months later.
The AMS supports a dark matter experiment.
The AMS experiment was originally launched to the ISS using a Russian Soyuz rocket.
The spacewalks will involve testing a new spacesuit that can withstand extreme temperatures.
The AMS repairs will involve attaching a new robotic arm to assist with future spacewalks.
NASA's Volatiles Investigating Polar Exploration Rover (VIPER) will explore the lunar south pole in 2022.
Rough estimates for water quantities at each lunar pole range from 100 million to 1 billion metric tons.
NASA intentionally crashed LCROSS into the Moonâ€™s south pole in 2009.
The water reserves on the moon can be replenished within a few decades through natural processes.
The VIPER rover will use solar panels to power itself during its exploration mission on the moon.
The VIPER mission is a collaborative effort between NASA and the European Space Agency (ESA).
On Mars, oxygen levels rise about 30% in the Spring and Summer.
Scientists hesitate to claim if the high amounts of methane on Mars are due to life, as is the cause on Earth.
When NASA saw unexpected methane and oxygen outputs on MARS, they checked if SAM was malfunctioning.
Curiosity's data shows that carbon monoxide levels fluctuate significantly with the Martian seasons.
The recent study on Mars' atmospheric oxygen was published in the journal Science.
The Curiosity rover detected the presence of liquid water on the Martian surface through its atmospheric analysis.
A focus of new manned spacecraft manufacturing is reliable functional parachutes.
Bridenstine says astronaut launch timelines are only possible if things go right, which is often not how these development programs go.
NASA began safety reviews of SpaceX after Musk publicly smoked marijuana on a podcast.
SpaceX's Crew Dragon capsule has a new type of propulsion system that allows for reentry into Earth's atmosphere without parachutes.
Boeing has announced a partnership with SpaceX to develop a new generation of reusable rockets.
NASA's Commercial Crew program will include a new round of funding exclusively for developing space tourism.
Astronomers are concerned about Musk's plan to launch thousands of satellites as it may alter detection of faint light in space.
Rural stargazers will be able to see a change in the night sky if all of Starlink's planned satellites get launched.
The protective nose of the rockets used to launch Starlink satellites are reusable if the company can catch them before hitting seawater.
The Starlink project has received funding from the United Nations to support global education initiatives.
SpaceX has received approval from NASA to use the International Space Station as a relay point for the Starlink network.
SpaceX plans to launch a second constellation of Starlink satellites specifically dedicated to climate monitoring.
Hayabusa2 went to Ryugu, a dark, carbon-rich asteroid 180 million miles away from Earth.
The goal of asteroid sampling is to study the ingredients that made our planets and look for the origins of life.
Japan's Hayabusa2 and NASA's OSIRIS-REx have similar goals, and thus the teams have worked together previously.
The Hayabusa2 mission discovered a previously unknown type of mineral on the surface of Ryugu.
The Hayabusa2 capsule's landing was assisted by remote-controlled drones to ensure it could be found.
The samples returned by Hayabusa2 include microdiamonds formed during asteroid collisions.
